Reviews.Title: “Good location, little and warm room”
Reviews.Author: Enrico N
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really close to the station Termini, so the location is really good: you find taxis, buses.. And if you want to walk, the city center is 15 minutes far. The room ( a double ) was really little and warm, but clean. The bad was comfortable, also the breakfat was not so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Elynton
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Clean, good location, good price. I've been there two times, the first in 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, if you need to get to ciampino in the morning”
Reviews.Author: PotterR
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, with better cleaners and a refurbishment it could be great. The staff were lovely, the room average, but perfectly acceptable. One thing - they don't do refunds. When you pay in advance they will not return your money.

Reviews.Title: “There are 3 stars but WHY?”
Reviews.Author: bron1960
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after checking out from another 3 star hotel in the Termini area. This hotel was very shabby except for the lobby. The elevator was small and the rooms looked tired. The staff were not interested in service. I was checked in but only given a room key. Apparently, you are supposed to be given an additional card so your room can use electricity. I had to see a cleaner on another floor to sort this out.They also have a curious policy of wanting to keep your room key when you leave the hotel. The shower is small and a large person could not access it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but low confort”
Reviews.Author: jcorrichan
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel late, around 1am, so I didn't have much choice. Although the staff were very helpful, the comfort of the room (inc bed), was very poor for a 3 star hotel. I would give 1 star hotel, but no more. Price is quite affordable and the location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Rudest staff in all of Italy!”
Reviews.Author: WillSafetyHarborFL
Reviews.Content: I now know what boot camp must be like. First off the place is run-down, over priced and they nickle and dime you to death. in order to watch any of the 4 TV channels they have in English it is an extra $7.50 a night. the internet is another $7.50 etc breakfast was over priced and barely edible this was my 5th trip to Rome and so far the worst hotel I have stayed in> The Hotel Stromboli is one step above a hostel, yet charges like it was actually a hotel. And be preparred to be yelled at by the staff, everywhere you look there are signs instructing you as to what to do ( hey I am a 53 year old man so not a party animal, but was literally screamed at for walking outside to smoke a cigarette without handing in my keys STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS

Reviews.Title: “BEST PRICE, BEST LOCATION, GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Bucketlist2011
Reviews.Content: We were booked at the Hotel Stromboli, near the Termini Train Station in Rome. We were booked there for 2 different stays. One for two nights, then again for 1 night after our cruise. I can't wait to come back to this place. Not only was the hotel immaculate, the staff was very courteous and professional. The price cant be beat, so I wasnt sure what to expect until we arrived. Their rooms are spacious and clean. Security is a plus. Their Continental breakfast was wonderful. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Just go there for maximum 1 night! better not!”
Reviews.Author: mofar1976
Reviews.Content: well, the only advatnage of this hotel is its location near to Termini and Bus to Airport. However, you can still find many other hotels around Termini. The worst thing which I saw was that the Bathroom of my room was out of the room! So, for a 3 star Hotel it is really cheap thing to offer for a rather high price. The size of room was very small! like a hole!! So, I did not argue with them since I was just there for a short night. But I do not recommend it to you. Find another one.

Reviews.Title: “Icky bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: jlc4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Stromboli as a part of a group tour (and had reservations given the other TripAdvisor reviews). I must say that the location was very good - close to the Termini, so easy access to transport to all parts of Rome. The lobby was pretty. The room was basic, which is okay, but the matress was thin and hard and the bathroom one of the most disgusting I've seen (and that includes the time I shared a house with 7 other people in college). The walls of the shower were moldy and the showerhead malfunctioned so the water shot out the top of it (all the better to rinse the mold off the walls into the standing water on the bottom of the shower). The bathroom also smelled of urine. Ick.

Reviews.Title: “Little above average”
Reviews.Author: gladiator32
Reviews.Content: Very central hotel across road from roma termini, room very ! small and cramped bathroom very small tiny shower . little bit pricey for what standard you should get for that money in Ireland . over all an ok hotel but nothing to draw us back there again for our next visit we will look elsewhere. The room was clean however the drains stink abit house keeping were very good with fresh sheets and towels every day, Not much of a view out the window as at the back of the hotel but very quiet then at night time so easy to sleep. when told there was abar in the hotel it comprised of a fridge in a corner with beer water and minerals in it and thats the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but good location”
Reviews.Author: kp31
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice - in July '06 and July '10. It's about as average a hotel as I've ever stayed in. Nothing memorable - either good or bad - but it's right across the street from the train station which is really great if you have an early morning flight out. The set up of the two beds in our double room was a little unusual but it didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nef_tr
Reviews.Content: i liked it..it was clean..the breakfast was nice!it was just a fews steps from metro lines kai bus stops.the staff was nice!i highly recommend it.you get what you pay.its a cheap hotel.if you want more luxury dont stay in stromboli..stop complaining alla the time.it worths the money..you go to visit rome the most beautiful city in the word you are not going to stay and sleep alla day in a hotel!!enjoy roma!!we miss it!

Reviews.Title: “The WORST Rome has to offer”
Reviews.Author: randomName19
Reviews.Content: Three nights in this hotel ruined what was a wonderful 2 week vacation in Europe. The room was unclean, smelly, small, and old. The service was awful - anytime we complained, we were yelled at. The breakfast was inedible. And the location was unsafe. Never have I experienced such dispicable conditions! Save yourself a lot of misery and stay elsewhere when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GT555
Reviews.Content: Bathroom was terrible even by Italian standards. Water poured out of bathroom into main room. All lights were feeble at best, bathroom nearly in darkness light was so bad. Toilet and sink dirty. 3 pillows for two beds and beds were rock hard. Street front rooms very, very noisy, location is surrounded by "undesirables" begging and scamming. Fridge did not work, LCD TV up so high on wall that it was unwatchable Breakfasts were best part of Hotel and were actually OK. However overall, avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever been to”
Reviews.Author: Hudrea
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful. We stayed in room 203. It was supposed to be a double room, but it had two separate rooms instead of a matrimonial, as we paid for and it was very very small. The window could not be opened and the room smelled badly. We couldn't even see outside, so no natural light at all. The curtains were dirty, the room was dusty, the walls were dirty, there were no carpets in the room or in the bathroom, the bath smelled too and the shower curtains were very dirty . There was an annoying noise in the room all the time we stayed there (non stop) and they couldn't/wouldn't do anything about it. The personnel speaks very poor English and do not understand what you're saying. Even if they do, they don't do what you're asking them to. The breakfast is a joke, it was horrible. There are only a few tables, almost always full of dirty dishes, the space is very very small, the food is always missing, there is only one person that does everything: cleans the tables (only every now and then), washes the dishes, brings food etc. Apparently it was the same guy that "cleaned" our room one day.

Reviews.Title: “No Way!”
Reviews.Author: No72
Reviews.Content: If this was the last hotel in Rome. I would buy a tent. No toilet, filthy carpet, noisy, small, More like a wardrobe than a hotel room. Could not spend the night . Walked around the corner and found a much better hotel at a cheaper rate. No no no no no !

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PRICE GREAT SPOT”
Reviews.Author: bluenosemanchester
Reviews.Content: was bit worried when read sum of other reviews,but was pleasantly surprised stayed 3 nites,makes me wonder what people expect for £60 a nite double,position was great across road frm shuttle drop off and trains metro underground is brill for gettin around stops near all main sites 4 euro a day,rooms were small but had basics my looked like new fixtures tv beds were old but sheets were clean breafast fine normal conti coffee was from machine but not big issue, bahtroom tiny but everything was new,slite wiff due to loo being saniflo if that means anything to you, keep seat down and plug in sink down we left window ajar when out just blind locked prob solved,area around not flash but thats the norm with stations odd drunk and tramp,and anyway yourl b out allday

Reviews.Title: “not worthing”
Reviews.Author: TravelTripVoyage
Reviews.Content: The rooms are too small.There is no bath.(only a shower source at the wall, without a cabin, so the water ends up to the floor of the bedroom).Very poor lightning on the "bathroom". The breakfast is poor. The matresses and the pillows are too uncomfortable (so much ,that you wake up with pains all over). The satff is relative polite. The location is not a nice one, BUT its very easy to transport, as all the means of transportation (termini station, bus station) are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “The worst bathroom ever !!!”
Reviews.Author: bstef72
Reviews.Content: Where to start? The only good thing about this hotel is his location near Termini train station but even that turned out to be a problem. Our room had its windows facing the street near the train station and we heard the noise from the street all night and we couldn"t sleep all night. The room smelled of chlorine, the linen was shaggy and it looked very ordinary. But the worst experience was the bathroom with no real shower (there was a shower head on the wall but no shower space and the drain was in the middle of the small bathroom). A little curtain was hanging on improvised support : as a result, the water splashed all over the bathroom. Two little positive points for the kindness of the hotel staff and the brand new TV/Internet screen in the room. But we expected more to be able to sleep well and to wash decently than to watch TV.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey, but good location”
Reviews.Author: ViajeraDeBoston
Reviews.Content: It was a little pricey, but staff was very friendly - let us check-in earlier because the room was available (allowed us to rest after a red-eye flight). Indeed - no AC before June 1st, so we opened the windows facing the street at night (great view of bustling Rome) - which made it noisier, but fine with ear-plugs. The room is spacious enough, bathroom - a bit tight, but so are many hotels in Italy. Not romantic - bu comfortable enough and good location. For money-wise travelers - a good choice. Great breakfast! (included)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ineedtotravelmore
Reviews.Content: After having had a very bad experience with another hotel, we checked into Hotel Stromboli last minute without a reservation. It is conviently located near the train station, the rooms and bathrooms were clean. The staff was very attentive and provided anything we asked for. The breakfast was included and I was impressed that the hotel staff opened the breakfast room early to accomodate our schedule. I read some of the other reviews and was surprised. Perhaps the hotel has remodeled, because my room and my friends room were fine and the bathroom and shower were as well. I thought this hotel was great, although a bit noisy with street traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel for young persons who want to save money”
Reviews.Author: Lusy_Irina
Reviews.Content: This is a very cheap hotel for staying a couple of the night. Good location, near the central station! Only 3 min. by foot! Nice food, but rooms are old and not very comfortable shower, terribly small bathroom! If you have an opportunity to stay in a better place than do it but if you want to save the maximum than its your place!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: hello_shy
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for the first time and were expecting to take some nice experiences with us ! Alas! The first worst experience was with this hotel First of all, the entire hotel itself is so clumsy that it's not worth paying even a penny. On the top of this, the hotel personnel (guy in the reception) was so rude and I should say that he's good for nothing ! There was another chinese guy in the evening who was very courteous towards us and he helped us in resolving some water & ac problems. Finally this hotel is a real waste of money!! Please do not prefer this - especially if you are having a family !

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: adeleojeda
Reviews.Content: It was near the Termini, and transpo was easy. It was not expensive, i would rather spend my euro on food, shopping and museums. Room wasnt the most opulent but we were comfortable. But we only sleep and shower in the room anyway. Hotel staff unobtrusive, fine with me.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place at the last minute”
Reviews.Author: MontanaAndy
Reviews.Content: Like others, I too checked at the rail termini for last minute accomodations and asked for medium price within walking distance. The agent suggested the Stromboli and it was easy to find, breakfast was adequate, and the staff were pleasant to me. Sure the rooms are small and could be noisy but I spent most of the time out of the room touring. I recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Run!”
Reviews.Author: nnbk
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel experience I've ever had! If you don't mind paying for a hotel room that you can NOT sleep in...this is the place for you! Arrived to a very hot, pre-paid room...was told that the air-conditioning could not be turned on until June 1st. Asked for a fan, they had none. Opened the ONE (screenless) window in the room, hoping for some cooler evening air. Went to dinner...came back, no luck! We had to leave the window open that night in order to breath. The noisy brick street, busy with it's constant traffic, honking horns, motor scooters, tourist buses, police sirens, and then early morning delivery trucks with their aluminum doors sliding up and slamming down, made it impossible to drift off for any more than a few minutes at a time. Not to mention trying to sleep on now wet sheets from pools of sweat! The next morning we all looked forward to a nice cool shower. We did not however, expect it to come from the wall mounted toilet tank above the commode, which sprayed you with a fine mist every time you flushed! Inside of the actual shower stall, the glass doors were lined with black mildew, and the shower door feel off into your hands every time you tried to open or close it. There were no washcloths, nothing but thin linen towels to dry with, and no mat to step out on. When we went down for breakfast, (which was nice), we shared with the staff how miserable our night had been and asked that something be done about the temperature in our room before we returned that evening. After a long day of sightseeing, we came back to find that our room key didn't work, and we had to wait for a master key to be located to open our door...and...our room was as hot as ever! So, we took things into our own hands and were fortunate enough to find a store where we could purchase a fan. With an hour of cooler night air being pulled in from the outside, we closed the window to reduce the street noise, and did get "some" sleep that night with the oscillating fan running back and forth over the 3 of us all night long. The sheets were clean but our son pushed his computer bag under the edge of his bed for the night and the next morning when he pulled it out, it was filthy with dust bunnies the size of Rhode Island attached to it. We left the fan at the hotel, and told the front desk staff to keep it for the next guest. No one should have to pay to endure a miserable night as we did! Not a chance for a recommendation from us for this hotel, other than, "RUN! DON'T WALK." Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean good value for money rooms”
Reviews.Author: bakebean
Reviews.Content: the hotel is easy to find, walk out of the station heading right the hotel is down the very next side street, all transport links to surrounding Rome are based at the Termini station inclding metro bus and train links to the airports so ideal, where ever you are in town you can find a bus back to the Termini. Even at night when the night buses operate. I couldnt imagine trying to navigate to another part of town, so staying near the station is a must. Our room was basic but clean and all you would expect for the price, excellent value for money id say. In our room we had sky TV (ok all the channels were in Italian) with a seperate shower room ensuite. I was very impressed with the cleanliness esp after reading some reviews for other B&Bs/ hostels in the area. This hotel is all you need for a few nights of sightseeing in Rome. The price you pay also includes breakfast, this is a self service breakfast with tea/ coffee or juice, cereals, pastrys, scrambled eggs, hams and cheese, yogurts, and fruit as much as you like can be consumed so brilliant for starting your day of sight seeing on. no complaints from me and i would definately stay again and recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Good, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: freckles22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my fiance for his 30th and post chirstmas get away. We arrived there at 1100am which is earlier than the check in time and without any moaning they checked us in straight away. They gave us a street map of Rome, and were welcoming The room was clean. (which was the most important thing!) It had en-suite with shower It had TV - with sky It had a fridge. It had a king sized bed. We were happy with the room, it wasn't the largest and they don't have Tea and Coffee facilities however there is a machine to get these from downstairs... Breakfast was included, Continental. The room was cleaned everyday with fresh towels put in. (Take shower gel etc) The hotel is a good location, we could walk to near enough everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced , unclean and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: chinaplate
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through the termini train station. Accommodation was in short supply and luckily we only stayed one night. We hade to get a cleaner to reclean the bathroom at 10.00pm at night so we could use it. The room was worth half what they charged and didn't include breakfast. Go some where else and enjoy Rome.

Reviews.Title: “good last minute booking”
Reviews.Author: braveboy
Reviews.Content: family needed three rooms in a hurry for three days, and the last minute booking desk at the termini station fixed us up..very very difficult to do in september in rome...the place was clean, staff polite and helpful. we would stay there again. Guy Family. tennessee, usa

Reviews.Title: “Hated it”
Reviews.Author: travelinghawaiian
Reviews.Content: Hotel Stromboli was a dump the room was over price and tiny. Hotel Staff was not very helpful and were really rude. The rooms had a aweful smell and bedding was very hard and ruff feeling blankets.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: clauma
Reviews.Content: This hotel is filthy we just returned on 10/12/06 had rented a villa in the country and decided to stay in the city for a few nights. The bedspreads where soiled under the beds hadn't been cleaned in years. The shower would not drain. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: freddicliff
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Hotel Stromboli at the beginning of this month. The hotel was selected by a friend who was meeting us in Rome and had stayed there for years. Unlike the previous 2 reviewers (who, I believe stayed there awhile ago), we found the hotel to be very nice. Our room for 3 was large and the bathroom could have been a small single unto itself. However, our friends opted for a room with no bath and, were amazed at our room, because theirs was nowhere near as nice. We also found it very quiet as our room was away from the street. (Again, our friends' room was on the street side, and was noisy.) Based on this, we would have rated the hotel higher, but give it a lower rating because of the price. Now, as I said, the reservation was made by a friend, so I did not have the opportunity to price rooms in Rome, but the Stromboli was about $230 per night (no breakfast included in this price). This was for a hotel just a few steps from the train station and a cab ride from the heart of town. And it was certainly no nicer than the other five we stayed at on our trip throughout Italy, all at least $100.00 cheaper per night.

Reviews.Title: “Served The Purpose”
Reviews.Author: QlDude
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last summer for one night after arriving on a delayed RyanAir flight at 1:30am. The terravision bus dropped us off at Termini (from Ciampino) and we were looking for the first hotel we could find so that we could get some rest. We immediately saw Stromboli (it is adjacent to Termini) and thankfully they were still open with someone at the desk. The man at reception offered us a discounted room, due to it being so late. I think we paid 80 Euros. We were just happy to have a bed to rest our heads for the night. The room itself was on the smaller side, even for Rome. The bathroom was clean enough, but was definitely old and could use refurbishment. In fact, the whole room could have used a refurbishment, including the beds. Overall, this place was not bad, and it definitely served its purpuse for us. It was quiet, and we got the sleep we desperately needed. We checked out the next morning and found a different hotel for the remainder of our stay. I would not recommend it this hotel for more than 1 night. This is not the type of hotel you want as a base for your Roman holiday. I would recommend it for people who want to be near Termini for early or late departures.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Stromboli
HotelInfo.Address: Via Marsala 34, 00185 Rome, Italy
